intro: Edraianthus parnassicus, commonly known as the Parnassian bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
